Description: Beautiful courthouse saved. It's worth the visit. Very nice staff.

Place Name: Historic Trails Park & Rope Ferry Replica
Description: A little bit obtuse to get to this place but definitely worth a visit if you just want to see an historical place. It's all outdoors with a couple of markers and some info. Our visit, June 23, was during the time trees are completely leafed out so even though the river wasn't that far away, we couldn't begin to see it from where we were. There were some trails leading back into the woods, but we decided they were a little too narrow and semi overgrown to feel comfortable about picking up critters like ticks. Good place to use your imagination!
This is a cool place with a wealth of knowledge of what it was like to live in rural Kansas in days gone by
Great memorial in the middle of nowhere, recognizing the land surveyors!

This is really an impressive museum.  You can tell that the efforts of many citizen volunteers went into making this happen.  That is very much to be respected.  It provides a cross-section of the unique way life in the area past and present.

Place Name: Hollenberg Pony Express Station State Historic Site
Description: Very interesting and historical story, the setting helps you imagine how they were in business many years ago.

A monument to the ice age with information about the animals and geology of that time period. The surrounding park and has a fountain and veterans memorial. The park is surrounded by interesting historic buildings. Most were closed.
Wasn’t expecting a stone like that, more of those copper signs you see. Having the stone was cool! Definitely down some dirt roads and through corn fields but was fun!
Beautiful round barn located in Marshall County,  Kansas
Church itself gave off a bad vibe. Something followed us home until we realized and told it it's not welcome. Deer almost made us poop our pants when running through the graveyard.

Very well done  a lot of things to see.
Very low admission$ 3.00 for  adults
I ENJOY  the  naive stone smoke house.
A lot of things did not seem old to me at first. Then I got my smartphone out an did  the math  and found out I am a babyboumer
Thanks for the memories.

There were bloody panties on the fence
Not good
Outstanding spot to follow the Oregon Trail.  Beware, if it has rained, you might want 4WD because it is an unimproved road.
The music was great and the lift was so helpful along with bathrooms.

This place is worth the drive off the highway to see.  It’s 4 miles, but with the rolling hills and farm ground will have you wondering what travel would have been like years ago.  To survey the new territory with primitive equipment unlike what’s available now Oh my gosh.

This was Piotique weekend. It was amazing. The murals in this little Kansas town are beautiful. We had my husband's 60th class reunion . The Cedar Court motel is very well remodeled, and also has a small continental breakfast.
A beautiful example of a early 20th century limestone home. Sadly vandalized but still beautiful.

My daughter and I had a wonderful personal tour by curator, Lori Parker, who is very knowledgeable and personable. It was a very enjoyable and interesting museum full of memories of the town and surrounding area that my grandparents and parents have called home for more than 40 years.
A piece of local history and a local gem! The Depot has a hardworking group of volunteers working to restore the building back to its original integrity and the beauty that it is.
